isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - DISASSEMBLE - NINE- AND TEN-SPEED TRANSMISSIONS

step1.para: Remove the bolts and washers from the range cylinder cover. Remove the range cylinder cover (Figure 117).

figure.caption: Figure 117. Remove Bolts And Washers From Range Cylinder Cover

step1.para: Remove and discard the gasket between the range cylinder cover and range cylinder housing (Figure 118).
Remove the nut from the piston in the range cylinder housing (Figure 118).

warning.para: If necessary, use a safe amount of air pressure at the LO range port to remove the piston from the range cylinder. If too much air pressure is used, the piston will come out of the housing with enough force to cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Remove the piston from the bore of the range cylinder. Inspect the large O-ring on the outer diameter of the piston. If worn or damaged, remove and replace the O-ring (Figure 119).
Inspect the small O-ring in the inner diameter of the piston bore. If worn or damaged, remove and replace the O-ring ( Figure 119).
Inspect the piston, especially the outer diameter for wear and damage. If worn or damaged, replace the piston and the housing as an assembly.

note.para: An O-ring is used between the range cylinder housing and the auxiliary cover on Design Level 1 Nine-Speed Transmissions. Replace with gasket sealant during assembly.

step1.para: Remove the range cylinder housing from the cover. Inspect the O-ring in the bore for the shift shaft. Replace, if damaged. If used, remove and replace the O-ring between the housing and the auxiliary case (Figure 120).
Inspect the range cylinder housing, especially the bore for wear and damage. If worn or damaged, replace the piston and housing as an assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 120. Remove Range Cylinder Housing And Inspect O-Ring

step1.para: Remove the mounting bolts and washers from the output bearing retainer to the auxiliary cover. Remove the retainer. Use a scraper to remove the sealant material from the cover and retainer (Figure 121).
Inspect the oil seal in the output bearing retainer. If the seal is worn or damaged, remove and replace the seal (Figure 121).
Remove the plugs from the output bearing retainer. Inspect the O-rings on the plugs. Replace worn or damaged O-rings.
If a mechanical speedometer is used, inspect the speedometer bushing inside the output bearing retainer. If worn or damaged, remove the bushing.
Remove the bolts and washers that fasten the holding cover tools on the auxiliary countershafts. Remove the holding cover tools.
On Design Level 1 Nine-Speed Transmissions, remove the snap ring that fastens the upper and lower countershafts in the cover. Remove the rear bearing cups ( Figure 122).
On Design Level 2 Nine-Speed and Ten-Speed Transmissions, remove the spacers for the upper and lower countershafts. Remove the rear bearing cups (Figure 123).

note.para: If a pin and clip are used to fasten the HI-LO fork to the shift shaft, replace with a nut and shoulder bolt during assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 122. Remove Snap Ring And Rear Bearing Cups
Figure 123. Remove Spacers And Rear Bearing Cups

step1.para: Remove the shoulder bolt and the nut (or pin and clip) that fastens the HI-LO fork to the shift shaft (Figure 124).

warning.para: When using a hammer and steel drift, wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. Do not use tools that are worn or damaged ("mushroomed"). If the tools are not in safe condition, pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: If necessary, use a hammer and steel drift to remove the shift shaft from the HI-LO fork (Figure 125).
Remove the HI-LO fork from the synchronizer collar (Figure 125).
Remove the upper and lower auxiliary countershafts from the cover (Figure 126).
Remove the synchronizer assembly from the output shaft ( Figure 126).
If worn or damaged, disassemble the synchronizer assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 126. Remove Auxiliary Countershafts And Synchronizer Assembly

step1.para: If worn or damaged, remove the front and rear bearing cones from the upper and lower auxiliary countershafts. Use a puller to remove the cones from the countershaft. Make sure the jaws of the puller are under the bearing races (Figure 127).

figure.caption: Figure 127. Remove Front And Rear Bearing Cones If Damaged

step1.para: Support the auxiliary cover on the low gear in a press. Make sure the output shaft is toward the top of the press Figure 128).
Put a sleeve on the top of the output shaft. Press the output shaft from the low gear assembly and the cover (Figure 128).

figure.caption: Figure 128. Position Output Shaft And Remove

step1.para: Remove the outer bearing cone and the spacer from the cover (Figure 129).

figure.caption: Figure 129. Remove Outer Bearing Cone And Spacer

step1.para: Remove the cover from the press. Remove the auxiliary low gear and inner bearing cone from the cover (Figure 130).

figure.caption: Figure 130. Remove Cover, Auxiliary Low Gear, And Inner Bearing Cone

step1.para: Support the case on a press. Make sure the inner surface of the case is toward the top of the press ( Figure 131).

figure.caption: Figure 131. Support Case On A Press

step1.para: Put a sleeve on the outer race of the inner bearing cup.
Press the inner and outer cups from the cover. Discard the cups.
On Design Level 1, Nine-Speed Transmissions, remove the toothed spacer from the output shaft or from inside the low gear. Remove the thrust washer from the top of the gear.

note.para: 115 and 125 series transmissions use one spacer on the output shaft. 135, 145, 155 and 165 series transmissions use two spacers on the output shaft.

step1.para: Remove the spacer(s) from the top of the output shaft ( Figure 132).
Inspect all parts. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT section.
